content.description: Starts at top of slabs left of the alcove above a tricky single bolt direct start. Nine bolts up the slab to anchors.

Another hard start leads to more sustained climbing than Lost Soles above.  Still feels runout!  Separate anchors to the right of Lost Soles.

Afternoon shade on this wall makes it very pleasant.
content.protection: 6-7 bolts to rap bolts, no chains
content.location:
The route just right of

Lost Soles.

content.description: Straight forward 5.7 slab most of the way to a fun patina finish.

Start up the low angle slab which gradually turns a bit steeper. About midway up the route step left across the large crack and continue up the steeper and highly featured wall. Very well protected climbing for the entire route. 70 meter rope recommended - use caution on the descent.
content.location: This climb is the 2nd route encountered at the left (south) side of the Lost World as you hike north.

content.description: As far as 5.4's go, this one was actually pretty fun. Begin on the mellow slab, clipping bolts as the wall gradually turns steeper on highly featured and quality rock.
content.location: This is the 3rd route encountered as you hike north along the Lost World wall.

content.description: Starts just below the obvious hueco.  A few hard thin moves at the bottom lead to steadily easier smearing to the anchors.
content.location:
Starts left of

Contra Friction

at the bottom end of the water-carved slab.

content.description:
From the Bingham guidebook: "Well-protected slab climbing! Climb a corner feature. Two ropes needed to descend."

The whole climb is well-protected, and the slabby crux above the bulge is very thin (all friction!)
content.protection: 12-14 bolts, withÂ chains at the top.
content.location: Just right of Truth is Stranger Than Friction.

content.description:
Steep friction at the start leads to much easier ground above.  The opening moves are hard but the climbing above is fun.  The whole thing has a runout feel, but that's friction climbing I guess.  The Bingham guide shows this route shares anchors with the route to the right (Truth is Stranger than friction) but we found a separate set of rap bolts for this line above the small moss cover step.

Needs more traffic to clean up.
content.protection: 6 bolts to rap bolts, no chains.
content.location: After walking around the corner to the Lost world, walk past the alcove below a bolt Line (12A to 10B) and along the base of the wall for about 20 yards.  This is the first line you come to.

content.description: Slab climb to the 'X' crack in the rock, easy patina climbing after.
content.location: Furthest route to the right on 'Lost World Left.' Find the obvious X crack on the wall and look for the bolts.

content.description: Up the low angle beginning (great Leave No Trace bolts; ended up standing on top of the first one before we could see it). Cross over the small crack then up to some good vertical climbing before going past a small tree and to the chains.
content.location: Start left of the big crack before Tourist Season. Very low-angle beginning. Tricky finding good place to stand for belay.

content.description: Step across the small stream and follow bolts up the low-angle grove.  Not hard at all if you trust your feet.  The guidebook calls it 5.9 but the 5.8 leader should be able to fake his or her way up.  A great route to take a new climber on, and teach them to trust their feet.  Cool spot.
content.protection: Lots and lots of bolts; nine of 'em plus the chain anchor.
content.location: At the far right side of the lost world. Right below a cool waterfall (flowing in the spring).

content.description:
Another fun well bolted pure slab in the vein of its modern neighbors to the right (

There's Friction Afoot

and

Contra Friction

), City Slicker will let you enjoy 70 some feet of friction without ever crapping yourself in fear (a common issue when climbing the old school lines further to the left).

Getting off the ground is the crux with a couple touchy moves (or a deadpoint) to a chickenhead and subsequent shenanigans to get your feet on it. Things ease up considerably after that with mellow slab padding past closely spaced bolt to another slightly harder section before the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts (7 or 8) to an independent bolted anchor.
content.location: City slicker is the 3rd bolted line from the right of the buttress, it takes the plumbline up a bulge following tan hangers.

content.description: Start in a sloping chimney that takes you to the 2nd bolt. Easy climbing to base of face, with a well-protected crux passing the 4th bolt. At the top of the face the route angles left up a nose with fun position. Anchors are a short distance below the End Game anchors. Route is a bit gritty in places, but it should clean up with traffic.
content.location: Route is by itself on the left as you round the south side of the Drilling Fields on the approach to Lost World.
